intro: Porterandia dinghoui, commonly known as the Dinghoui sandmat, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of China. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with succulent leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Porterandia dinghoui is considered a vulnerable species.
